definition: to confer/to grant/to bestow a title/to seal/classifier for sealed objects, esp. letters

sentences.english: She saved the envelopment after she opened the package.
sentences.chinese: 打开包裹后她把封皮存了起来。

sentences.english: That is the book whose cover (ofwhich the cover/the cover of which ) was broken.
sentences.chinese: 这就是那本封皮破了的书。

sentences.english: He tore at the cover of the parcel.
Our people can print the cover sheet with this.
sentences.chinese: 人们可以用这种纸打印封皮。

sentences.english: The cover of the parcel tears easily.
My book has a dark blue cover.
People are queuing up for soup made of boots and book bindings.
sentences.chinese: 人们排队领取由皮靴和书封皮煮成的汤。

sentences.english: Starched reinforced fabric used to strengthen a book binding or the spine of a bound book .
sentences.chinese: 用于加固书本封皮或合订本书脊的浆硬加厚织布。

sentences.english: Don't overpack like a traditional egg roll.
sentences.chinese: 别像传统的蛋卷一样将给包上其两层封皮。

sentences.english: I see. Inside material. What kind of cover would you like?
sentences.chinese: 明白了，内部资料，封皮要什么材料的？

sentences.english: The cover of the parcel won't tear.
Well, at least the way the better-designed covers look!
sentences.chinese: 呃，至少是那些设计精美的封皮。

definition: dust jacket (of a book)/protective cover/document seal
book/notebook/Japanese-style self-published comic (esp. an erotic one), aka "dōjinshi"/CL:本[ben3]/edition
